page.title: 13N.Upottery:Buildings.
page.content: There are no public buildings in this area:pub, church and village hall are all down in the village.We have only farms,with the occasional cottage or bungalow.The latter are of fairly recent construction and their masonry-painted walls and composition-tiled roofs have not yet harmonised with the landscape. The old farm-houses are built of rough stone,with thick walls and wide ingle-nook fireplaces. Their rooms are often on different levels,because of the sloping nature of the site(always well chosen,sheltered,near a spring and enjoying lovely views).Many still have thatched roofs,though others have had them replaced by slates.All but the very smallest farms have a double set of buidings,the modern concrete silos,sheds and milking-parlours sitting next to the older outhouses.
